name: Essen
fun_fact: Fun fact: Essen was the heart of Germany's Ruhr industrial region - the Krupp steel dynasty powered German industry here, and the Zollverein Coal Mine (now UNESCO site) is one of the world's most beautiful industrial monuments.

hero_dishes.name: Currywurst
hero_dishes.description: Grilled pork sausage sliced and smothered in curry ketchup sauce, sprinkled with curry powder, served with fries
hero_dishes.origin_story: This post-WWII invention became Germany's most beloved street food. Born in Berlin but perfected across Germany, currywurst represents working-class food culture of the Ruhr region. Steel workers needed cheap, filling, fast meals - currywurst delivered. The sauce recipe is often secret, each stand claims theirs is best.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Street food stalls throughout Essen - locals claim 'absolutely best Currywurst of Witten' in the Ruhr Area with 'best French fries in the World!', various budget-friendly spots serving curried sausage with fries

hero_dishes.name: Schnitzel
hero_dishes.description: Breaded and fried pork or veal cutlet, served with fries and cucumber salad or triplets
hero_dishes.origin_story: While schnitzel is Austrian, Germans adopted it enthusiastically. Ruhr region portions are massive - expect enormous schnitzels that hang off the plate. The breading should be crispy, the meat tender. It's German comfort food - simple, satisfying, affordable.

hero_dishes.name: Bratwurst
hero_dishes.description: Grilled German sausage served in a bun with mustard, or on a plate with sauerkraut and potatoes
hero_dishes.origin_story: Bratwurst is German soul in sausage form. Each region has its version - Ruhr region's reflects industrial heritage with hearty, filling sausages designed for manual laborers. Grilled over charcoal, served simply with good mustard and bread or with traditional sides.

hero_dishes.name: Hearty German Fare
hero_dishes.description: Pork knuckle, sauerbraten, potato dishes - filling Ruhr region working-class meals
hero_dishes.origin_story: Essen's industrial past created hearty food culture. Coal miners and steel workers needed substantial meals. Traditional German cooking here emphasizes portions over finesse - it's fuel for physical labor, elevated to regional pride.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: RÃ¼ttenscheid district (recommended for dinner with local beer and schnitzel), traditional German restaurants throughout Essen

signature_drinks.name: German Beer
signature_drinks.description: Local pilsners and lagers - Ruhr region beer culture runs deep
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served in steins at traditional restaurants and beer gardens. The Ruhr region's working-class heritage means beer is everyday drink, not special occasion. Paired with schnitzel, currywurst, or bratwurst. Affordable and excellent quality.
